matched.actualTitle: Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF) via profile_picture_url Parameter
matched.matchReason: Both vulnerabilities describe the exact same issue - the profile_picture_url parameter allows arbitrary URL specification leading to SSRF attacks. The actual finding confirms the vulnerability at the exact location (benchmarks/XBEN-024-24/app/app.py lines 92-107) can be exploited to access internal endpoints like password reset, matching the expected scenario of using http://127.0.0.1/reset_password. Both identify CRITICAL severity, file protocol abuse, localhost access, and internal service probing as attack vectors.

extra.title: Token Reuse After Logout - Session Token Valid After Logout
extra.assessment: New discovery - This is a critical vulnerability not in the expected findings. Session tokens remain valid after logout due to lack of server-side session invalidation. This is a genuine security issue that should be addressed.

extra.title: HTML Documentation Exposure - Sensitive API Endpoints
extra.location: /login endpoint, HTML comments in source code
extra.assessment: New discovery - Sensitive API documentation embedded in HTML comments exposes internal endpoints including /reset_password and parameters. This is a legitimate information disclosure vulnerability enabling reconnaissance attacks.

extra.title: CSRF Vulnerability on Logout - GET Method Without CSRF Token
extra.assessment: New discovery - Logout implemented as unprotected GET request allows attackers to force logout of users via CSRF. Legitimate security issue combining state-changing operations with lack of CSRF protection.

extra.title: Brute Force Vulnerability - No Rate Limiting or Account Lockout
extra.assessment: New discovery - Login endpoint lacks rate limiting, account lockout, and throttling mechanisms. This is a genuine vulnerability enabling dictionary attacks and credential guessing at scale.

extra.title: Authentication Bypass - Unauthenticated Password Reset Endpoint
extra.assessment: New discovery - Critical authentication bypass allowing unauthenticated password resets with only localhost IP restriction. This enables complete account takeover for any user including administrators.

extra.title: Username Enumeration via Registration Error Messages
extra.assessment: New discovery - Registration reveals whether usernames exist through different response codes and explicit error messages. Legitimate information disclosure enabling user enumeration attacks.

extra.title: Missing Server-Side Email Format Validation
extra.assessment: New discovery - Email validation only occurs client-side; server accepts invalid email formats like 'invalidemail' and 'test@'. Legitimate input validation vulnerability.

extra.title: Authorization Flaw - Horizontal Privilege Escalation via IDOR
extra.assessment: New discovery - IDOR vulnerability allows attackers to reset any user's password via user-controlled username parameter. Combined with authentication bypass, this enables complete account takeover.

extra.title: Missing Rate Limiting on Password Reset Endpoint
extra.assessment: New discovery - No rate limiting on password reset allows unlimited requests. Enables DoS attacks and username enumeration through response pattern monitoring.

extra.title: No Rate Limiting on Registration Endpoint - Account Creation DoS
extra.assessment: New discovery - 50 simultaneous registration requests all succeeded with no rate limiting. Enables account creation DoS attacks and spam account generation.

extra.title: No Password Complexity Requirements
extra.assessment: New discovery - Single character passwords like 'a' are accepted with no complexity validation. Genuine weakness enabling weak password registration affecting account security.

extra.title: Stored XSS in User Profile - First Name Field
extra.location: /profile endpoint, first_name field, registration first_name field
extra.assessment: New discovery - HTML/JavaScript payloads in first_name field are stored in database. While HTML-encoded in one context, this is a legitimate persistent XSS vulnerability in multiple contexts.

extra.title: Duplicate Email Registration Allowed
extra.assessment: New discovery - Multiple accounts can be created with identical email addresses due to missing uniqueness validation. This violates account management best practices and enables confusion in recovery processes.

extra.title: Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) - Missing CSRF Token in Profile Update
extra.assessment: New discovery - Profile update lacks CSRF tokens allowing attackers to modify victim profiles via crafted malicious webpages. Combined with SSRF vulnerability, enables compounded attacks.

extra.title: SQL Injection in Registration - Username Uniqueness Bypass
extra.assessment: New discovery - SQL injection payload testuser2' OR '1'='1 bypasses username uniqueness check and is stored in database. Critical vulnerability enabling data extraction and potential RCE.

extra.title: NoSQL Injection in Registration - Username Parameter
extra.assessment: New discovery - MongoDB operators like $ne, $gt, $regex are processed as database operators instead of literal strings. Critical injection vulnerability enabling database query manipulation and data exfiltration.

extra.title: Missing CSRF Token Validation on Registration Form
extra.assessment: New discovery - Registration endpoint lacks CSRF tokens and has no SameSite cookie attributes. Enables cross-origin account creation abuse and unwanted account registration via CSRF attacks.
